subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to write effective tests?
msgSnippet: Hey Dave, Did you announce your book on the TDD list?  I must have missed it...  When is it due for publishing? Cheers! Carl ... From: Dave Astels
messageBody:
Hey Dave,

Did you announce your book on the TDD list? I must have missed it... When
is it due for publishing?

Cheers!
Carl
-----Original Message-----
From: Dave Astels <dave@...> [mailto:dave@...]


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Carl Hume" <chume@d...> wrote:
> I would reccomend Kent Beck's latest: Test Driven Development: By
> Example.

I'll second that. I'll also suggest that when you're done reading
Kent's book, you a) read it again,and b) watch for my TDD bookto hit
the shelves. See http://www.saorsa.com/page.php?page=pgtdd for more
info. I've received very positive feedback from several folks,
including: Mike Clarke, Alan Francais, Bill Wake (who reviewed it),
and Ron Jeffries (who wrote the forward)... so I feel justified in
suggesting it. Also, e sure to check out my TDD Edition of The Coad
Letter (www.thecoadletter.com) which is free BTW.

Dave
